preqs: 12 credit points at second year level in Art History and Theory, or Theory of Art and Design, or Visual Culture,  or permission from Unit Coordinator

rules.ruleString: (Must have passed 2 (I/W) units in {CLS1%, VSA1%} OR  Must have passed 1 (I/W) units in {AHT1%, TAD1%})

description: This unit examines the medium and its materiality across a range of visual art practices including: painting, sculpture, installation, photography, video, multi-media, social practices and performance art. It focuses on a historical lineage of art's mediums and disciplines and how they are framed, constituted and judged in a diverse range of academic fields. Concepts and traditions of modern aesthetics, the effect of late-capitalism, socio-economic critiques of art and technology are pivotal to any understanding of how art's form moves between modes of medium-specificity to trans-disciplinary realms. The unit introduces key theoretical tenets to analyse late modernist and contemporary art practices as case studies. It introduces students to the critical dialogue around the medium and artists' material processes.
faculty: Faculty of Art, Design and Architecture
